text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

I've always been
the kind of person

who wants to dig
deeper into questions.

And a PhD just felt like the
right path to me because it gave

me the space and the
tools to explore the why

and the "so what" behind many
things that we oftentimes take

for granted, like how we as
consumers make decisions every

day and how marketing
shapes our choices.

My research focuses on how
digital business can extract

customer insights
from unstructured data
to aid their decisions.

The predominance of unstructured
data like images, videos,

and multimedia offer great
opportunities for business

to enhance their customer
experiences and personalize
offerings.

As a doctoral student,
you'll get great support

from the program to
connect with practitioners,

to access business
decisions and data,

and to test and build your
research in the field.

Two things make
our program unique.
It's truly interdisciplinary.

We're pulling from economics,
psychology, data science,

and more to get a well-rounded,
comprehensive understanding

of marketing strategies
and consumer behavior.

There's also a strong
focus on making sure

that our research has
real-world impacts.

This combination of academic
rigor and practical implication
is truly valuable.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
